text: What a great surprise while visiting Hyde Park.
Even without a reservation our party of 8 was quickly seated.
Excellent service.
The food was amazing, you can tell they prepared it with care and the mixed flavors  on the bowls...
Wow.
Good job guys!
Sheri is the best.
Such good food & drinks and an even better ambiance!!!
Will be back ASAP.
Sat 14 people at one table and one person waited on us and was beyond anything we could have asked for!!!!
The best place.
We had out of town guests and wanted to go to Hacienda on Monday, Dec.
19th.
I called on Sunday, Dec.
18th to ask if they would be open and what were their hours.
I was told that they would be open and that the hours were 8 to 8.
When we arrived about 7:05 we found the doors locked.
My husband went around to the back door and entered.
He was told that they were now closed because they didn't have any business.
Needless to say, we were not happy.
The staff in the restaurant said that we should be sure to make a reservation so they would know that someone was coming!
The staff apologized and said it was company policy.
We proceeded to go to Montgomery's and had a great time.
Factory Donuts is a fantastic Donut shop.
There is ample parking behind the shop.
The coffee is very consistent and tasty.
The staff is very helpful and courteous.
The dining area is immaculate and well kept.
There are even a few tables outside if you wanted to relax and ease into your day with your coffee.
They have a wide variety of donuts which are all very tasty.
I think I've had just about all of them at this point.
The donuts are rich and cakey, not at all light.
They are very reasonably priced for the quality of donuts you receive.
They are all made fresh to order so they are still warm when you eat them.
I am lucky to have them right in my neighborhood but if it were not in the neighborhood, I wouldn't mind taking a drive to pick up a dozen or two.
Well we popped in here spur of the moment starving and it did NOT disappoint.
From the Hostess to the food runner the staff was unbelievably friendly and sweet.
The food was incredible will definitely stop back before traveling home.
Sometimes we overlook the places that are right under our nose !
This would be one of them.
I have lived in the Mt.
Airy/Germantown area now for 9 years and often dine further away and do not venture enough in my own hood !
Two dear friends and I stumbled upon Grain Exchange when we were trying to find a decent place to eat after 9p last evening and it came up right away on Yelp.
I knew it had received good reviews so was happy to have the opportunity to finally check it out first-hand.
Service was enthusiastic and warm and welcoming.
The atmosphere was both funky and quaint.
A fantastic menu selection,  including an entire page of vegetarian items.
We started off with fried pickles ...
I have no words.
Just a lot of joyful groaning !
The pulled pork sandwich was tender and had crunchy surprises like pickles and cabbage that married perfectly.
They offer 3 different sauces:  a spicy (which was great yet not really all that spicy);  a sweet (not a fan);  and a vinegar (my favorite !).
The best part, however, of the meal which blew me and my dining partners away were the sweet potato fries !
Huge thick perfectly roasted specimens of sweet potato fry heaven, with just the right amount of salt.
Put the vinegar on them as suggested by our server and your mouth and belly will thank you.
One friend got the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich and utterly loved it - esp the mayo that is given with it.
The other friend got the fried fish sandwich and was equally delighted.
Great giving business to the local peeps.
They do it up right !!!
Great staff!!
Cold beer ,good wings great grilled cheese and great cheese steak.
German S.
Should just move back to him home land if he doesn't  like Monaghans.
We took the grandkids here last night, and the place was so dirty I would have left, except the kids wanted nuggets.
The food is good, but the seats and tables were dirty and the floors were disgusting.
Looks like they tried to mop  the floors with dirty mops.
Ugh.
Strong, balanced machiattos for me ...
smooth, silky decaf latte for the wife.
I was going to try a cappuccino, but they serve them in larger mugs than I prefer.
Rather than risk that the espresso would get lost in the milk (see my La Colombe review), I went for a double machiatto instead.
We didn't get any food here but the menu/pastries looked good.
Loved the European vibe and decor.
I'd absolutely recommend getting your morning espresso fix here (instead of getting regular coffee at Honey's a few doors down).
Best Eggs Bene I've had in a long time.
Bloody Mary's oh my!
And definitely will order the biscuits and gravy again.
We might just walk the Grants Trail next time!
Definitely will be back.
Really good food.
The people are friendly and knowledgeable.
I recommend it if you are in the area.
Another plus is the price.
It is very affordable.
Over the past year or so, Needler's has become my go-to grocery store.
It's the most convenient option for all those who live on Mass Ave or in an adjacent neighborhood.
I used to go to the Kroger on Michigan but just grew tired of the garage parking and the mostly college-aged clientele.
Needler's has a wonderful parking lot you can enter off of New York or New Jersey.
I also find that the store itself is clean, logically organized, and stocked with whatever items are on my list.
The cashiers are always very friendly.
Rest assured they have a loyalty program similar to chain grocery stores.
Needler's also has a hot bar, salad bar, extensive bakery, donut and candy selection, deli, butcher section, and the new Lemon's Cafe with a coffee bar and lots of grab and go options.
Sometimes too crowded.
Food is decent, but can be pretty pricey.
The portion size is a lot though.
Service is always great here.
The first time I had a slice at Vito's must have been 1983.
I passed out in someones car after a Jerry Garcia concert at the tower theater.
That someone dropped me off at Vito's.
Thank you thank you thank you.
Even though it was far from my home(I had a 3 mile walk) I ate my first heavenly slice of Vito's.
Yes it was greasy and yes the crust was crunchy(without hurting the roof of your mouth) yes I have been back many times since.
Last week I visited again more than 20 years later and the pizza still captivated me.
Somewhere that wasted teen ager is still enjoying his slice of heaven.
Awesome ice cream, great beer selection, and friendly service.
A great unique place to enjoy dessert and an adult beverage.
Try the flight to get your choice of ice creams paired with local draft beers.
This cafe was one of the reasons I moved to Philly.
Cozy, great coffee, stellar sandwiches and soups - really friendly staff.
Plus: later than your average-cup-of-joe-place hours!
Anything coconut is excellent.
Colonel Mustard (sandwich) is a must try.
I've also gone on date here before so, you know, it's a good meeting place too
Was visiting family in the area.
My husband and I stopped here for dinner.
I had prime rib which was excellent.
Very tender.
My husband had the rib eye steak.
That was excellent also.
The macaroni and cheese is awesome.
We had carrot cake and coffee for dessert.
Very good also.
The atmosphere and customer service is top notch.
We enjoyed it so much that we went back the next day.
This will be our go to restaurant whenever we are in town
I'm very picky on what Indian restaurant I go to.
I happened to go here on someone's recommendation.
Didn't like the fact you get plastic plate, folk & knife to eat at a restaurant.
It's not to go or airport.
I would expect real plates & silverware.
We ordered a masala dosa the dosa comes out & it was plain.
After bribing this to their attention - they got masala in a separate bowl (really?).
We weren't offered water either.
They should put up a sign saying SELF SERVICE!
Wow.
Finally good pizza.
Being from New York where there is Pizza places on every corner it's awesome to find this gem.
It's an old home renovated into a retro style pizzeria.
Great music playing, album covers as menus and absolutely delicious pizza and salad.
Excellent food!
I custom made the best vegan breakfast burrito ever.
Soyrizzo, hash browns, pico and black beans.
Not on the menu but the lovely lady taking our order, helped me out.
I somehow never had fancy ramen until recently.
It seems to be a big, current trend and I think Ichicoro does it well.

Polar_expression: to be a big, current trend

text: The flavor was there.
The only thing I'd change is the chicken.
It was kind of hard to eat a full piece of chicken in a bowl of soup.
It would be helpful to have it chopped.
Overall, I was very impressed.
Our server was Dennis and he far surpassed any customer service that I've received anywhere.
I would highly recommend trying thir muffalata or their fresh seafood.
Top knotch!
Visited New Orleans on business and will definitely come back!
I went in here a while back.
It's spacious and clean, though it was more of a sterile, corporate coffee store type feel to it.
The place had a real weird vibe.
If my trip was a movie it would be "Day of the Living Dead Laptoppers".
No one was talking, there was no music playing, and all I could here were mouse clicks and people staring/mesmerized by their Macs and PC's.
I ordered an Americano and the servers made it promptly.
The coffee was not that great and they charged 2.80.
The servers  weren't that friendly as well, though in fairness they weren't surly either.
Not really worth going back there.
I'd rather go to Cafe Clave or Lovers and Madmen.
Great place for breakfast.
The atmosphere is cool and the service was great.
I ordered the Hail Mary, which is an oversized Bloody Mary with 3 strips of bacon and about a half of a grilled cheese sandwich.
It was great.
That could have been my entire breakfast.

Polar_expression: could have been my entire breakfast.

text: Also got an order of the pancakes for my boys to share.
The pancakes were really good and their bacon is cooked well.
My wife got the French toast.
Came with a bunch of slices, not as good as the pancakes.
This restaurant had very friendly staff and larger than average beer selection.
I had a popcorn appetizer/snack with a unique twist.

It gets only four stars because outside of happy hour it's a bit overpriced and though there are many beers on tap, during the summer it was difficult to find a Stout or Porter on draught, which I understand is likely not in great demand during the summer but I was hopeful since the name implies they specialize in beer to find at least a couple of beers of the style I enjoy most.
I will come back for the five dollar cocktails during happy hour again and hope during winter they have some good stouts and porters on draught as draft beers are the most reasonably priced.
They do have some unique bottled beers but at $7.50-$15 per bottle it's a little more difficult for me to enjoy.
Overall nice place though, I would recommend it for a beer and a snack or anytime during happy hour.
Excellent meal and good service.
Calamari was perfectly seasoned and lightly breaded.
Highly recommend.
This is some of the best Mexican food in the stl metropolitan area.
Nice selection of imported beers and tequilas.
very friendly hospitality.
And excellent shrimp cocktails
I went here with a party of 6 on a Friday night.
After reading some of the reviews on here, I was a little nervous but was wonderfully surprised.
We were seated right on time, and the service was prompt and friendly even though you could tell they were extremely busy.
Definitely expect to be seated right on top of each other, I have never seen a table so close to my table in a restaurant before!
However, I went here expecting that and surprisingly didn't mind too much.
The dining room was loud since it's quite packed, but in a boisterous way that added an upbeat atmosphere.
I was also with a bunch of friends though, so I can see how that would be annoying if I was on a date or something.
The food was delicious, and the tastes were unique.
The prices were absolutely phenomenal for a restaurant in center city.
Overall, I had a good experience here and will definitely be back since the atmosphere was enjoyable, the food was good, and the prices were unbeatable!
OK...
I'll start by saying that the gentleman who I believe is a manager, Chris (long braids) is amazing.
Super nice guy.
When he is running the window/drive-through, things flow and your order comes out (9 times out of 10) correct.
So this review is in no way a reflection on him!
This facility however, needs more workers like Chris.
I don't know what is happening here but lately they've had a really tough time getting my order correct.
Hardly anyone repeats your order back to you at the speaker.
Today (like previous days) I had to pull forward and wait for my order.
When the young man brought my order out it was wrong.
After I told him what I ordered, I waited, and my order came out wrong AGAIN!
Do people have a hard time hearing?
Are the headsets for the drive-through that crappy that the workers cannot hear the orders?
Or, are they just not paying attention?
I've been coming to this DD for years because the service has always been spot on (until recently) and the workers were always super nice.
I've noticed a change in both.
Chris needs some good help!
Hope this company will get him some!
And Chris, if you are reading this, thank you!
YOU ROCK!!!
A really fun breakfast spot that we found on our second day in NOLA.
Food was yummy and the service was fantastic.
Only thing keeping this place from five stars was the strange and eclectic decor.
Set in an old bank building, there was some turn-of-the-century bankness, some Art Deco in the bar, and some rather homemade looking decor around that.
This has the makings of a true five star establishment with a little elbow grease in the decor.
I loved this place!
This was my first visit and I was impressed.
Great service, great drinks (the Hurricane was on point and strong) and the food (shrimp creole) was amazing!
That was the best meal I had in NOLA on this first visit.
Pat O'Brien's is a must visit!
I'm still on the fence about returning to NOLA.
We will see!
Seems this place is overrated.
We were excited to come here since it boasts to be in the top 10 places to eat breakfast in Nashville.
You enter the building, get in line with your menu and place your order.
My son even paid a 20% tip in advance.
Once you have done this, you go find a seat.
We sat outside and the table  hadn't even been wiped off.
Our food arrived along with coffee and cream.
The food was adequate, but there was no refill on coffee or the customary return of the server to make sure everything was ok.
Perhaps the service is better inside, but I won't be returning to find out.
We came in for chicken cutlets because our regular place doesn't do hot sandwiches on Sundays.
I've had this place bookmarked for a while to try and it did not disappoint.
My husband got the chicken parm sandwich and I got the cutlet sandwich with mozz and broccoli rabe.
Both were really good and inside the deli is really authentic.
I was making so many mental notes to come back to do some ingredient shopping.
We will be back!
The burgers are usually delicious, and so is the unlimited salad bar.
Tonight, the burger was especially tasty and the tater tots that came with it were excellent.
My husband enjoyed the salad bar, for the most part, but didn't care for the ranch dressing - neither the low-fat or regular dressing suited his taste.
It's the only salad dressing he likes, so he was not totally satisfied with his meal.
The wait staff is always friendly, efficient, and ready to fill an empty glass.

Polar_expression: ready to fill an empty glass.

text: Tonight was no exception.
We had good service, and the meal was good, too.
We will be back!
Went for dinner with husband and our two little guys.
We heard they supported local farms and business.
The decor is very cool and trendy.
Cloth napkins.
Loved the diverse menu items, the server Dean was great with us, accommodating our youngest sons dairy allergy.
We loved everything we tried, avocado burger, lamb burger, jalapeo burger, and a plain burger on wheat.
The nights total was more than we expected, but everything was worth it, maybe not a weekly treat, due to cost, but we will be back again.
Also every table seemed to have kids...so if you are anti little people, have a back up plan.
****they use peanut oil-allergy weary patents beware****not noted on menu or any place else, chef confirmed yes, they use it****
We went for a late lunch /early dinner.
It was our first time dining here.
Started with fried pickles which were very good then the Cuban sandwich and the inside out burger both with garlic fries.
Awesome!!
Ended our meal with fried Oreo and ice cream.
Super!
Great little place.
You won't be disappointed.
Caf Luna is one of those local secrets that you hesitate to review, lest it become mobbed.
It's in a house tucked away on Summerland's main drag, and easy to miss.
There's a full porch out front and a fireplace going on rainy days.
Luna has had a rollercoaster ride of successive owners in the years since it first opened as the French Bulldog, and I've watched every phase.
It has new great owners and the same super friendly and helpful staff (Elizabeth, Emily, Katy), and it's the perfect place to slow down your busy life.
Great espresso, great food, and it even has French pastries from Renaud's.
I usually have breakfast here when I'm in the Santa Barbara area.
Lots of cool places to kick back inside or out.
I should go back and rewrite this, because it sounds like an ad written by the owner or something, but I have to be somewhere in twenty minutes.
Sorry.
So just know that everything I wrote is true, true, true.
Popped in with my girl for lunch.
There was a long wait for a table but we lucked out and grabbed two seats at the bar top.
Food was great, double bacon cheeseburger and that spicy ranch are bomb, but Fred was the best.
Amazing service, super personable and funny!
Come by and grab a drink or a bite and sit at the bar with Fred!
Grabbed a cup this morning after a workout -- caught them just as they were opening I think.
But they were still super friendly and served up a great iced coffee.
Looking forward to my next visit!
I go to Wards at least once a week for some variety of fresh fish.
On my way to the register I always have to pass by the prepared food case and each time I always eye the crab cakes.
Well this past week I gave in and purchased two for my husband and me.
We were not disappointed--they were DELICIOUS!!!!
This place is the bomb.
Every single thing I've had here is juicy tender great food.
KIM CLINE is the absolute worst fast food worker/shift manager i have ever met!!!
She was insanely disrespectful to me and the customer behind me in the drive thru.
I am blown away by her attitude.
This women's horrific attitude caused me to go out of my way, create a yelp account and write a complaint.
I am still in awe of how rude she was.
She is impatient and overall just mean!!
Worst service ever, I could not complain enough.
Im seriously questioning how she ever got this job.
She should not be put in a position where she can communicate with others let alone tell others what to do.
Very very disappointed.
Ruined my day.
I am NEVER going back to this Arby's again.
A great place serving classic American-style Italian dishes like penne alla vodka and linguini alle vongole.
They use very fresh ingredients and execute them very well, making this place really stand out.
I also tried a steak sandwich, which was delicious: flavorful without being greasy or too heavy.
And the bread (both served at the table and the sandwich bread) is very, very good.
And the prices were very affordable, making it excellent value for money.
The staff were extremely welcoming and accommodating of our 9-month old daughter.
This place is a hidden gem in an unassuming strip mall.
Check it out!
I've visited the Weber Grill in Chicago and this one in downtown Indy is on par as any other Weber Grill.
I'd recommend getting the House Burger.
You will definitely leave feeling full and satisfied!
I learned something important this morning at IHOP.
A Stack of 5 Buttermilk Pancakes is $5.99, a Short Stack of 3 is $5.49.
And all you can eat is $4.99.
I ordered a short stack, and the waiter asked me how I wanted my eggs.
"What?
I just want the 3 Pancakes!"  Shocked, he informed me I'd be a fool not to get the AYCE Pancakes (That's what the cool kids at IHOP call it I suppose).
So, with the all the choices I ordered the All You Can Eat Pancakes.

Polar_expression: So, with the all the choices

text: And got 5 anyway.
Ok, the bar is gorgeous.
How often do you encounter a story-book spinning carousel as a bar?
Definitely worth trying to gin fizz, as this is where it originated.
However, mega-overpriced.
It's crowded a lot and it's kinda difficult to be accomodating and accomodated as it rotates.
Also, can draw in a snobby, elitist, touristy group.
Not a fun crowd to drink with.
Stand-offish.
Deluxe burger was outstanding.
Love those caramelized edges on the beef.
Crinkle fries were crisp and perfectly fried.
Highly recommend.
Local, neat decorations, friendly servers, trendy t-shirts.
It's a taste of the southwest in St.
Louis.
Whether you're looking for breakfast or lunch, they have it.
The fiery scramble is good but really anything on their menu goes with hot sauce.
Check it out!
What a great place to grab a slice or two (or a whole pie).
I was somewhat boring and just got two cheese slices, but they were great.
Crust could've been a bit crispier, but they were served piping hot and with plenty of cheese.
It's nothing fancy, but I'm reminded of the pizza parlors of my childhood.
I'm told they deliver, but not sure what the area is.
Staff was very gracious and friendly.
So the cinnamon almond cream brioche they had today is pretty much obscenely outrageous.
Love Breads on Oak so much!
My only frustration has been the last two weeks I have ordered multiple items to go, paid for them, and then when I get home, I am missing things I paid for.
Will start checking in store before I leave from now on!
I love a good steak.
LOVE steak.
I'm a true believer that a properly prepared steak does NOT need fancy sauces or A1.
I've been here twice in recent memory and both times I left disappointed -- mostly because if the reputation this place has.
Picking your steak and size is fun, but in the end I care about flavor...
and for me it just wasn't there.
The prices are extremely high and honestly - I would prefer a steak from my wife over this place.
Heck, I'd prefer to go to Flemings right down the road in Marlton -- same prices (or better) and 100x better and fancier.
I'm not 100% sure, but I remember feeling a little miffed at the choices of sides and their prices.
The salad bar is extensive, but who really goes out to a steak house for salad?
If you want a great salad bar come here, but if you want steak go to Flemings (or Outback honestly).
Best coconut shrimp I've ever had!
Fries were good.
Coleslaw was bland and forgettable.
Husband loved his fish basket.
His lemonade was so weak he asked for lemons and sugar to punch it up.
My mojito had enough liquor but was too tart.
View from second floor and ambiance was very nice.
Would come back.
Excellent tikka masala.
Very good naan.
Best Indian I've had in Tampa.
Great service.
Very friendly!!
Awesome smoothies, best around.
Fresh ingredients for a great taste.
I come here often when I need a quick snack/ meal replacement.
There are few decisions I contemplate more deeply than where to go for my annual birthday meal.
During a moment of deep meditation (okay fine, my mom suggested it lol) I decided to celebrate another trip around the sun at Krab Kingz.
The location itself is nothing special, tucked in a nondescript strip mall off of Watson.
The interior is sparse and smallish, but the staff gives off a welcoming vibe that makes it all seem enduring.
I ordered a #2 that included two crab clusters, shrimp, sausage, two hard boiled eggs and potatoes.
I also added a lobster tail for good measure.
The thing that sets everything off right is the choice of seasoned butters that are offered.
I went with Cajun and a spicy butter on the side (be warned it is truly spicy, a plus for me).
Everything was delicious
Everything was delicious
We made a reservation for Abe Fisher after numerous unsuccessful attempts to get one at Zahav.
I am so glad that we had the chance to experience this wonderful restaurant because it was the best meal I've ever had!
Our waitress recommended the Montreal Style Smoked Short Ribs, and we took her word for it.
It seems pricey at $60 per person, but it provides the full restaurant experience and includes numerous small plates, an enormous serving of ribs, and dessert.
The attention to detail in the drinks, food, and service goes a long way and makes this a very special restaurant.
Get here as soon as you can!
Seriously!!!
What a find!
Family style seating and meal.
Great conversation with new friends.
Today on the menu was fried chicken - oh my goodness!
- fried catfish which i do not ever eat but it was absolutely perfect !
Mashed potatoes, greens, banana pudding, green beans, biscuits, corn bread, gravy.
I know I've missed something!!
You should not miss it!
Take the time to go - you will not be disappointed!
This is perhaps the BEST Taco Bell in St Louis!
The staff is soooo friendly all of the time.
I mainly eat here for breakfast and the portion sizes are awesome, the food hot and fresh and the store is clean!!
(Take note ALL other fast food stores!)
(Take note ALL other fast food stores!)
Staff never gets frazzled.
Wish the Area Mgr could get their other stores to step-up like this one.
I'm the founder of a local social group and we have been coming to this Dave & Busters for 11 years.
Other BBW groups such as mine have been coming to D&B for over 20 years even back when this was called Jilly's.
I have brought within the last 2 years parties of 25-30 people.
This past saturday night there was a threat of icy roads and basically my group didnt show up to this event.
Turnout was very low.
The manager assitant Eric basically treated us very bad.
everytime he came into our room he gave us dirty looks.
Also he read us our contract and since we are a non-profit group he waived the room rental fee.
We have never had to pay a room rental fee.
At the end almost to punish us he tried to get $150 out of us even though the contract said no room rental fee.
Our meals came out cold.
We had to send back our ribs.
We ordered a full rack of ribs and were served a half rack..
6 ribs is not a full rack.
He messed up our bill several times before he made it right.
Our waitress Jesse was very nice.
Its the assitant manager Eric that really messed up our time there.
Very upsetting
Wonderful!
Loved this place SO much.
The customer service was outstanding and the food was delicious.
There is so much to choose from in NOLA to eat, a lot of competition.
As a frequent business traveler I will be back next time im in NOLA, usually I dont say that!
I came here with some friends after a long afternoon of shopping at the Westshore and International Malls.
It was our first time so when we came in we were a little confused on whether were supposed to be seated or not.
There seemed to be a host area, but no host.
After standing around for a few minutes a waitress eventually told us we could sit where we want.
So we found a booth and then waited a while for the waitress to finally come around.
We all ordered wings, they have a 35 cent special on Mondays that start earlier than Wingstop.
I ordered BBQ and some of my friends ordered Buffalo but they ended up mostly tasting the same, with no real kick in the Buffalo wings without going to hot.
The waitress was okay, not on her A-game, but seemed to be trying to an extent.
We wanted to order some wings to go as well, but apparently there is a policy against that, and french fries took forever to come until after our meal was pretty much over.
You also have to order a drink besides water as a condition of getting 35 cent wings, which is at least $2.49 for a regular drink, so the savings kind of balance out.
Overall, good food but not my favorite experience.
My goodness, what a cute place!
We came here for a Sunday brunch and had just a short wait.
As soon as you walk in, you get a great vibe from the place.
The food was delicious and generous portions.
The staff was super friendly and the place was very well taken care of.
We'll definitely be coming back!
4 stars but really 3.5 just to be clear.
El Berraco is a nice place for a dinner with some friends a family with a fun submarine theme that really fits the whole seafood theme.
Food was pretty good, we had the fried calamari and crab tostadas.
The crab meat was sweet and based on the color and texture I believe it was blue crab.
The reason for 3.5 stars is the service was lacking a little bit.
It took a while to place our order and to get our drinks, it was a Friday night but it wasn't too busy as there was no wait for a table.
Also the pricing is pretty high for what you get.

Polar_expression: pretty high for what you get.

text: I understand that seafood is high in Tucson but 5.50 for a shrimp taco is a bit much.
I will probably be back as I stated before the food is excellent but maybe I'll wait for a day that I feel like splurging quite a bit
After going to the wrong location, I finally made it to the new spot.
Needless to say due to that I arrived fairly close to their closing time of 2pm.
Unlike many other places that make you feel bad for walking in so close to closing, the staff here was so welcoming!!!
I was not made to feel rushed at all, given time to look over the menu, and our server even made some amazing recommendations for food and drink.
Jess B was phenomenal!!!
I had the cucumber bloody and it was very refreshing.
For my lunch I had the Mardi Gras omelet with potatoes.
Man that hollandaise was the bomb!!!
Our table was checked on by the general manager, corporate trainer, and chef to make sure everything was on point!!
I definitely recommend going here for some great food, chill atmosphere, and some of the best service I've had in a long time.
And I have high standards since I'm a bartender.
Don't forget to ask for Jess!!
Tried the AYCE wings (Monday and Tuesday - $15).
You can get any of the regular flavors (not grilled) in any amounts.
We pretty much tried every flavor.
Overall I thought the sauces were kind of lacking.
A couple were pretty good (Whiskey Bourbon and Cajun).
The garlic parmesan didn't have much flavor at all, and the Southwestern and New Orleans were just...
odd.
The rest were fine but nothing to write home about.
Fries were alright (better than BWW's generic fries but not as good as Wing Stop).
The wings were normal size.
Service was good, the guy (Truman?) was helpful and enthusiastic.
I'd probably go back and try the grilled wings.
They have $2 draft beers all day on Wednesday.

even on my recent visit to this fine restaurant, where i found the food to be top rate and excellent, the service to be very friendly, courteous, and also excellent, the atmosphere very nostalgic, quaint, and romantic, there was one thing that bothered us greatly.
my partner and i love martinis, and we usually rate restaurants by their martinis.
if we feel the pour isn't generous enough or the glasses are too small or the price of a martini is way too exorbitant for the quantity, then the restaurant is taken off our list.
such was the case here where they don't carry top shelf vodka such as Greygoose or Belvidere or Ciroc, but an unknown such as St Pete Vodka and charge $16!!
for an almost 3/4 glass!
well, say no  more...bye bye Pia's.
we wondered what they would charge for the other vodkas i mentioned.
Ehh ..
we like this spot for a good beer list and live music but food is really hit or miss.
Chicken bowl last night had cold, clearly out of the fridge chicken on it.
They did redo it and it was hot the 2nd time.
However, when we ordered a platter the bar tender later came back and said no garlic mashed potatoes so we changed to French fries.
Potato for potato right?
Nope, surprise up charge on the bill and the manager pretty much picked a fight with us via the bar tender refusing to take it off - even for a customer who got cold food!
Forget it.
That was small but annoyingly ridiculous.
Food is mediocre at best anyway - little flavor.
I've driven by this place many times and never stopped in until last week.
The style of the interior is amazing!
Whoever designed the restaurant really knew what they were doing!
They have a crazy amount of options to pick from for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
We went there to try out their breakfast on Labor Day.
My boyfriend loved his bread bowl egg scramble and would definitely recommend it.
I had the eggs Benedict with potatoes, wasn't a fan of the potatoes but the Benedict was great!
We will definitely be stopping in for lunch or dinner this month to try out the rest of their meals - the menu definitely makes me excited to come back!
The ice cream is unbelievable.
Nowhere have I seen flavors like they have, and I mean that in a good way.
Things like almond bourbon and salted caramel.
It's the best palce in Tucson for ice cream.
The food is really good, too, but I've only been there once, so I've not eaten all they have to offer (yet).
Definitely will go abck again!
Ok obviously Morgan's is great for its atmosphere and for people watching and blah blah blah.
But their food?
Ugh, pass.
My friends and I picked a table closest to the water near the larger bar.
Bad idea if you want table service because you might end up waiting anywhere from a minute to FORTY minutes just to get drink orders in.
Despite our large group and trying to hail whomever was around to grab our order,  we ended up only getting our orders in about an hour after we sat down.
That was indeed a bummer.
Anywhoo,ordered the  italian sausage because I was starving and my friend had told me that their burgers weren't really on point.
I expected the sausage to be just like any other sausage:bit greasy but flavorful.

Polar_expression: just like any other sausage:bit greasy

text: I knew it would be coming with some kale and garnish on top, but when I bit into the entire thing, the kale tasted literally like grass.
I dumped the kale-garnish to the side and ate only about a half of the sausage.
The sausage itself tasted as if it were burnt ( i couldn't really tell because of course it was dark as hell ).
My other friend ordered the pickled beans or asparagus (something green that was pickled).
That was pretty solid and was consumed within minutes.
Their clam sandwich was made as if, in the words of my friend, "someone just dumped a bunch of clam meat into an open hamburger bun and hoped the sauce would flavor it up.
"  She wasn't too thrilled by the lack of oomph for the sandwich and didn't eat the entire thing.
The fries were nothing special-not even any rosemary or spices to coat the fries.
Our waiter was helpful and even returned for us a few drink orders that weren't made up to par with no hesitation.
hands down one of my favorite bars, the staff and owners are great.
They have kareoke on mondays.
The food is delicious.
Be sure to try the stuffed mushrooms or fried pickles.
Its a very friendly neighborhood bar.
Not uptight at all : )
As a vegetarian, bar food can be difficult.
Here though, being a vegetarian has never felt limiting.
They have a good black bean burger that you can use in any of their different unique burger creations.
From my meat eating friends, I also hear that the regular burger is quite good.
The beer selection is huge, no doubt you will find something you like here.
As I walked in, I noticed the lunch rush and thought I would be standing in line all day.
I was wrong.
The clean, friendly pizza restaurant got my food ready within minutes.
The chicken Caesar salad was a good portion, but could've been larger for nearly 10 bucks.
The pizza selection looked excellent but I have yet to try.
Livery has been at the top of my 'must-visit' list for YEARS, and last night, I finally made it in.
I'm happy to report that it was worth the hype and even better than we imagined.
We booked a weeknight reservation for two, found easy parking on Mass Ave, and were immediately seated at a comfy table.
The dim lighting, luxe chairs and kind servers made for a great atmosphere.
Bonus: I thought the guy dining next to us worked at the restaurant because of how many servers he knew, but my husband told me afterwards that he was a Colts player (LOL).
After reading through the hundreds of rave Yelp reviews and doing our research, we decided to order the following (with a Metazoa Peanut Butter Porter beer - SO good):
After reading through the hundreds of rave Yelp reviews and doing our research, we decided to order the following (with a Metazoa Peanut Butter Porter beer - SO good):
Lamb empanadas: Our favorite item of the night.
They seriously melt in your mouth and the meat was incredibly high quality.
They came with a poblano crema dipping sauce that was DELICIOUS.
I couldn't believe that it was only $9 for three empanadas.
So great and not spicy at all.
Skirt steak: My second favorite item of the night.
The steak was cooked perfectly and tasted great with the broccolini, tomato crema, jalapeno butter and manchego-polenta fries.
Canelones: Almost like latin-inspired crepe full of pulled chicken, tomato sauce, tomato crema and salsa.
It was super good but slightly spicy.
I've heard that the churros and flan here are incredible too, so we'll definitely be back for those soon!
I also can't wait to come back when it's warm and sit on the rooftop.
Be sure to get a reservation before stopping in here, as this place is POPULAR!
Hold off for a real steak and fries from Jim's, Pats, or Genos or little Nicks.
This place isn't very good.
Employee was friendly and nice
We arrived at Mekenita Cantina on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch.
The inside is very trendy, with lots of big wooden booths and a small bar inside which is beautifully tiled.
We were seated immediately and given complimentary chips and salsa.
The chips were so good, they had just the right amount of seasoning.
The salsa was good as well, a little on the smoky side.
I do wish they offered queso here, I think it would be delicious.
The house margaritas here are fantastic!
It's weird to me that they don't have them listed on their drink menu, but ask your waiter about them.
They were so tasty and very strong.
We ordered a pitcher and it definitely wasn't watered down like most normally are.
They also use pellet ice or "Sonic ice" as I call it which makes them that much better.
For entrees we ordered the Crab & Roasted Poblano Enchiladas and the Chili Garlic Smoked Pork Enchiladas.
Both were absolutely delicious, the Crab & Roasted Poblano Enchiladas were super creamy while the Pork Enchiladas are covered in their traditional Mole Negro so it was much more of a smoky flavor.
You aren't going to find your traditional Tex-Mex here, it's definitely more authentic Mexican (which I didn't mind) but you'll definitely find more strong and smoky flavors.
The side salad that came with it was surprisingly really good and the dressing had a nice kick.
Service was good though they were running extremely far behind.
The manager was actually walking around to all of the tables apologizing and explaining why their food was taking so long which I really appreciated.
He even comped a few diner's meals since it took so long.
It's rare to see a manager making things right like that.
As a side note, the parking lot is SO small.
They tried to cram way too many parking spots and it's a super narrow mess, but don't let that deter you.
Price were a little higher than your normal Tex-Mex joint, but well worth the price in my opinion.
Small place, limited inside seating ....
but the noodles are AWESOME.
I've had 3 different dishes here and was impressed with all three.
Service was fast, our server explained the 2 dishes we had questions about.
He also made 2 recommendations, both of which hit the mark with us.
Can't wait to go back and also to try the owner's other restaurant "The Little Octopus".
First off, reservations are a definite smart idea.
My friend and I met there at the bar at 5:30 and had a table reservation for 6.
I don't think they start seating people until 6 anyways.
By 6:30/6:45 the place was packed including the bar and stayed that way even as we were leaving at 8:30.
My friend described the vibe and decor as "Restoration Hardware-ish" and she really like it.
It is a trendy upscale place for sure.
They don't have an expansive craft beer list, but they do have a respectable craft beer list.
From Terrapin Hopsecutioner and Moo-Hoo to Good People Pale Ale.
There is valet parking, but if you are lucky like I was you can find a spot on the street.
I will say that my experience at the table was more enjoyable than at the bar.
While there wasn't anything wrong with the bartender and he was friendly enough, there was also an aloof attitude there.
Although, I will say that I've been feeling like that a lot around town with the bartenders.
I think it is actually the vibe they are going for.
But again, he was friendly enough.
Our waitress was very friendly and could read when we were talking in depth to not interrupt us.
We started off with the Lobster Bread.
It was a $14 "Bite" and was 4 small toasts that had a bit of lobster on top.
This was probably the least enjoyable part of the meal.
Not that it was bad.
It was just an okay appetizer.
While I understand that the lobster is the reason behind the $14 price tag, I wouldn't order this again because I didn't feel it was worth the price.
If they could find a way to bring the price down to $10 then it's more of an appetizer price.
My friend ordered the Brussel Sprouts from the "Vegetable" portion.
These.
Were.
Insane!
I would order these just for my entree if I go again.
And they are big reason behind the 3 stars.
Luckily my friend let me split these with her!
For the entree, I ordered the Scallops and my friend ordered the Spaetzel.
The Scallops were $21.
For that price, you received 3 sizeable perfectly prepared scallops.
They were atop a small bed of roasted potatoes and mushrooms and small cubes of ham.
While I appreciated that the serving was a perfect size for one, $21 for 3 scallops is still a bit pricey.
Let me be clear that I don't mind pricey and I don't care to be served a ginormous plateful of food that I cannot eat.
But I think that if this dish were at $15-17, I'd be ordering this all day long.
My friend enjoyed her spaetzel and pork belly and had enough to take leftovers home.
I'm not a fan of whole grain mustard and this dish is full of it.
So I did not have a taste of this.
All in all, it was an enjoyable meal, but a lot of it was that I was able to catch up with a friend I had not seen in while.
I think they are doing a lot of things right here and there is a lot of potential.

Polar_expression: a lot of things right here

text: I would go back if the prices dropped a bit.
But it is a great spot in 12 South and they are lucky to have it!
(4.5 stars) This place feels like a chill spot to sit at the bar and grab some whiskey, and it has some pretty great food.
Though, the place doesn't feel like it was really meant to serve food.
Seating is super scarce, and handling just our party of 3 seemed challenging, so we ended up having to sit at the bar.
I was going to go with a burger, as I normally do when choosing between breakfast and lunch, but the burgers don't come with fries, which makes them even pricier than they already are.
So, I went with the village breakfast to try a bunch of things.
I'd highly recommend it, especially at only $13.
I really appreciated their take on toast, which wasn't simply slices of white or wheat like you would get most elsewhere, but instead was sliced baguette drizzled with olive oil.

The Andouille sausage had a real nice kick to it, the eggs were light and fresh, the potatoes had a bit of a crisp to them, and the slaw of onions and peppers atop the potatoes was an effective, tasty bridge to the rest of the plate.
It won't disappoint.
I'm in love!

I've been following the Autoimmune protocol diet, which is EXTREMELY restrictive (no gluten, dairy, nuts, legumes, soy, nightshade veggies, I could go on!) It's been difficult at times because it's eliminates most food options outside of my kitchen.
Although Green Table didn't have anything I could eat on the menu, Emma sat with me and discussed all my options until they found something yummy and delicious for me!
I am so grateful.
Seriously, I want to convince them to make it a permanent menu item!
It was delicious and very clean!
Some other restaurants do their best, some have completely dismissed me without concern, but green table really took the time and care for me.
It means more than they could know!
I've been following this diet for 5 weeks with 8 more to go!
Green table made me feel a lot better about that.
I'll be coming back for their salads, smoothies, and juices!
One of our favorites!
I love the blackened chicken sandwich, it is delicious.
The prices are a bit higher then other comparable places but you get what you pay for in that respect.
Everytime we are down towards Back Yard Burgers and we are hungry we always eat there!
Dined in for lunch with a group of ten after waiting an hour and a half.
Service was super slow!
We all shared and tasted the Just Watch, grilled redfish, crawfish Etoufee, Morrow's Fried Chicken, oyster's Morrow, crab claws, peach cobbler, and crawfish bread.
The food was served cold and super late!
We asked for the manager 5 times after not receiving several items but being charged.
The manager finally came as we were about to leave.
Also important to note,  they will only split the bill into 4 but didn't inform us until the bill was delivered.
Our server was Miesha.
Regarding the food, each item was super delicious but the extra long wait took away the enjoyment of the food.
Jennifer was my waitress and she was great!
Good service, good food, and nice presentation.
Highly recommended
Just returned from a great meal at Palladino's.
Everything my party ordered was delicious.
I had the rib eye rare, kale salad and the potato galette, as well as shared bites of the oyster app and a mushroom item.
Everything was perfectly cooked and delivered to our table with perfect timing.
We devoured it all and I have nothing but praise for the food.
Our service was also very good.
It was not terribly busy for a Friday night, which surprised me, so we got a table immediately without reservations.
That usually makes me nervous but It was a great meal.
Chalk it up to the weather, which was our good luck.
And this is for the owner:  I would not have questioned the high prices if the decor was just more refined.

If you're going to charge Rittenhouse Square  prices ( $38 for a steak with sides another $7 per) get rid of the televisions showing loops of scenes from Italy that makes me hear Mario Perrillo's voice in my head.

Spending this kind of money on a meal (about $300 for a party of three with drinks, apps, entrees, sides, desserts) is a huge treat for most people including me, so I don't want to look at an electronic screen after staring at one all week.
The food I ate on this visit deserved to be the focus.
It did not make my food taste less delicious, but I think you will make more money if you keep it cleaner, design wise.
The food is different than the other spots on the Avenue so I think fills a unique niche.

Polar_expression: than the other spots on the Avenue

text: I look forward to trying other items on the menu, and will just try to sit out of the line of sight of the televisions.
We have been there many times and never were disappointed.
I have been to bakeries in almost every great city (NYC, Chicago, San Francisco, Charlotte, Seattle ...)  and have never found anything comparable.
Quality ingredients - incredible service - and a taste that is unsurpassed.
Try one of everything and nothing will let you down!
Came back here the second time and it was amazing!
I love their the matcha mille crepe.
We also got orange green tea and mango green tea, also very good.
This is now our regular spot in chinatown!
Fresh, tasty sandwiches in a clean, modern building.
Disappointed that the eggs were instant on the breakfast sandwich.
Service was excellent, coffee was very good.
PLEASE NOTE!!!
There is a scam going on here regarding the parking.
It's beyond the control of the restaurant.
There's a circle in front of the building.
No signs on the street, or in any feasible location.
You pull up, park, sit down and eat.
A girl pops out, records your license plate, puts a valet ticket on your window telling you to pay her before you leave.
It's $2 every twenty minutes.
Their clocks aren't accurate.
I ask her a question that I'm sure she's asked a hundred times a day.
"where's the sign?".
Tucked up close to her booth is a sandwich board perfectly position so you can't see it unless you leave your car, and walk toward the other side of the building.
This scam is being run by Central Parking of Philadelphia!

Polar_expression: run by Central Parking of Philadelphia!

text: So if you plan on eating here, plan on adding parking fees to your breakfast/lunch !
Another solid option for dinner has come to downtown Franklin.
Fortunately for me, we haven't had a chance to check it out until now.
It appears that they have worked out some of the issues that others have complained about in previous reviews.
Located in the former Gray's Pharmacy building, the restaurant consists of three stories of dining space.
My husband and I decide to check out the recently established restaurant.
As typical of downtown Franklin, the restaurant has a nice ambiance with the architecture and exposed brick.
When we arrived at 5:45 p.m.
we were told that they were completely booked for the night with reservations (which I find odd that that they book EVERY table in advanced like that).
However they do have open seating in the bar area on the second floor.

Luckily, we were there early and found a seat at a two seater table in the area (the bar area has enough space to seat about 7 couples at tables plus about 10 seats at the bar and 4 bar top tables to stand at).
We usually make reservations, but at the time, I didn't even know what the name of the restaurant was!
The menu is a combination of small plates (a nice variety of options) and about 6-8 entrees.
We decided to share three small plates.
We had the chorizo corn dogs, hot chicken, and the fried pimento cheese balls with homemade whisky pepper jelly.
My husband enjoyed them all.
I wasn't a huge fan of the corn dogs, but I'm not a huge chorizo fan.
The hot chicken had good heat, and was served on toasted white bread and pickles.
I really liked the creamy sauce served with the hot chicken.
The pimento cheese balls with the pepper jelly were my favorite.
We had banana foster for dessert.
The bananas were wrapped in tortillas, deep fried, cut in half, and served over the sauce.

Polar_expression: wrapped in tortillas, deep fried, cut in half,

text: It was good, but I much prefer the bananas cooked in the sauce.
Apparently this place is the first "brandy bar" in the country.
I don't drink brandy, so brandy mixed drinks didn't appeal to me.
However, they have a great beer selection-not the everyday brews you see everywhere else!
Everything on the menu looked good.
The service on our visit was excellent as well.
We were definitely impressed enough that we'll check them out again in the future, and maybe catch some of the live music (they have a nice stage on the second floor).
Yummmmmm.
I want to eat here every day!!
You gotta try their vegetarian sandwich.
It's incredible!!
And the mango salad with the mango yogurt dressing.
And the million dollar bar omg one of the best deserts I've ever had!
When I doordash for work they are also so quick with getting out the orders which rocks!
Thank you to the staff for hustling so much!
A standard, well-run Jersey Mikes!
I've come here a handful of times during the lunch hour, as I work down the street.
There's usually a good buzz around lunch time, but I've never seen it get TOO crowded.
When I order sandwiches ahead of time, they're always ready to be picked up.
When I wait in line, it runs fairly quickly, and the employees are pleasant.
Love me a good turkey wrap.
I was looking for some something different to eat one day.
And again Yelp to the rescue.
Being in a part of town that I do not send much time in, I looked for something interesting on Yelp.
I saw the Buffalo Wild Wings and the alright reviews so I thought I would give then a try.
Without Yelp I do not think I would have known that they were there.
When I was seated it took some time to decide on what to eat.
I was pleasantly surprised to see a nice selection of menu items.
They also have a nice choice of sauces to put on your wings, is you decide to order the wings.
I had a hard time choosing, so my server brought me so samples of the sauces.
It was primitive but effusive.
She had the sauces, squirted a little on some paper for me to dip my finger into for the taste.
I had a hard time choosing between the traditional Buffalo sauce and the roast garlic, so my server suggested that I do half of my order with each of the two sauces.
Great idea.
I loved both sauces.
The place was clean, service was friendly.
What a fantastic surprise we had last night!
I had not tried this restaurant due to all the bad press when it first opened (chef walked out).
Now I am SO sorry I waited so long.
The food was amazing.
This is a high end Mexican restaurant that will not disappoint.
Today some friends went to PF Chang's to eat lunch.
Food was very good and good service.
Tino's is without question one of the most authentic Italian spots in Santa Barbara.

Polar_expression: question one of the most authentic Italian spots in Santa Barbara.

text: Their sandwich menu is very simple, yet delicious.
The restaurant is very clean, the service is superb and even though there's always a line, they move really fast.
I always get the super deluxe and their bread is always fresh and all the meats and veggies are on point.
Their portions are "just right."
Their portions are "just right."
This place is a "weekly" must if you live near by.
My husband and myself decided to try a new place after moving here a few months ago.
We had a feeling after arriving at the restaurant on a friday evening with only a few table filled that the food was terrible to say the least.
I had ordered the wood planked samon with sides of garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli.

The samon tasted like it was sitting in the fridge/freezer for a year, and the garlic mashed potatoes had hard pieces of potato in it, garlic fumes were coming out of my nose, and the broccoli was brown.

My husband had ordered grouper, again it tasted like they had it a year ago sitting around waiting to be eaten the fries were a joke-just a handful, and the corn was the kind in the frozen section of the grocery store that was mushy.
I would never ever recommend this place, and wonder how they are still open......What is up with the paper towels hanging over each table on a wire hanger?Tacky,tacky,tacky.
UGH.............I would rather starve.
Buffet is decent; at least they have fresh jalapeno, onion, and lemon to add some flavor.
Dinners usually have better flavor but they charge extra for rice which I find lame.
This is a great spot and a great value for the price.
We had dinner here last night and two drinks, two starters, two entres, and a dessert were $65 bucks before tip.
A great deal in my opinion.
I'd definitely recommend the yucca fries and Cauliflower and shishito for starters.
I had the chicken enchilada verde and my wife got the pork pastor.
Both were great but I the chicken enchilada  was the favorite for both of us.
We will definitely be back again!
April 2017
Some of our favorite dishes are just not as pleasing as they used to be: spring rolls, dumplings, mei fun, and skimpy orders of sesame chicken.
We had a great run.
All the best to the China Dragon.
Oct 2015
this is darn good eats.
And - it's family.
Supporting a business where you see a family at work together is a plus.
The dishes are made to order with special instructions always noted...
spicy, fried hard, light sauce, etc.
Pick up or delivery - the time frames are always spot on as well.
They have a good thing going on at China Dragon.
A bit pricey for the amount and quality if food
Very tasty and fast.
This is the only place I've found authentic chicken shawarma.
I had a sandwich with fries, and I felt like I was back in Jordan.
The pita is fresh and it comes with mayo/tahini, and Middle Eastern style pickles.
The fries come seasoned and all food is made fresh to order.
The service is very friendly and the place is clean.
We will be returning!
